summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, providing the password for a disc containing discovery materials related to her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of the letter, an inmate at MDC Brooklyn, who is the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, acting as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, corresponding with the defendant regarding discovery materials.

connections.description: Strauss, as the U.S. Attorney, is corresponding with defendant Maxwell regarding the provision of discovery materials in her criminal case.

events.title: Discovery Password Provided
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends Ghislaine Maxwell the password for a disc containing discovery materials pertinent to her criminal case.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
MDC Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center, P.O. Box 329002, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell regarding her criminal case (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password for a disc containing discovery materials, indicating an ongoing evidence disclosure process in September 2021.
Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn at the time.
Audrey Strauss was serving as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York when this correspondence was sent.
